The darkness of these shadows will decrease as they re-
cede from the light; the second having one reflecting surface 
interposed between it & the eye will be lighter than the first, 
the third shadow having two, will be lighter still, & the fourth 
having three reflecting surfaces between it & the Eye, will scarcely 
be perceptible.
Ex. 3. If instead of a small wire, a thick cylinder of half an inch 
diameter is held over the slips of glass at right angles to the 
direction of the light, the several shadows will overlap each other, 
& form a dark shadow in the middle bordered with lighter 
shadows, corresponding to the number of surfaces of the glass 
plates; but those towards the light instead of growing lighter 
as they recede from it (as was observed with respect to the 
shadows of the small wire) will grow darker as they approach 
the principal shadow; because in this case each preceding 
shadow is overlapped by the succe[e]ding one. 
Ex 4. If instead of the cylinder we adopt a slip of Brass [card] or Tin 
3 or 4 inches long & 3 broad painted black on both sides to 
prevent all reflection, & if this card is held in a perpendicular 
position over a single glass slip lyeing flat on a Table, & 
within 1/10 of an inch of its surface, the dark shadow of the 
card will have one lighter border; if there are two slips 
of glass laid on each other, the dark shadow will have 
two lighter borders; three pieces of glass will give three, 
& four pieces four borders. the first of those in order 
next the light will be on the upper surface of the upper glass 
only, & ther[e]fore will be lightest; the second consisting of two 
shadows overlapping each other, viz. that on the upper 
surface already mentioned & also that on the two contiguous 
surfaces of the upper & second slips (forming in ef[f]ect but 
one surface) & ther[e]fore will be darker than the first. 
the 3d border in like manner consisting of 3 shadows 
will be darker than the second, & lastly the fourth 
border consisting of four shadows will be darker than 
the third.
